comments.commentBody: I love Derek Jeter, but I really would like to see the NYY move him to 3B (if only they could trade A-Rod, thank you Hank!) or LF. Trade Granderson and move Gardner to CF. SS is a defenders position and even after his good year in 2009 he'd be better for the team at 3B or LF now.

Yeah Mitre is pretty lame. And the Johnson signing is one Cashman will have to live down. They better not exercise their option on this turkey. I really hope they move A-Rod to DH and shift Jeter to 3B. Let's be inventive this off season:
Let Andy retire
Let Vazquez leave as a free agent
Sign Cliff Lee
Trade Granderson, honestly this guy is terrible.
Shift Gardner to CF
Sign Crawford for LF (unless they move Derek there)
Yes. let's get rid of Mitre, I'm not sure why Girardi loves this guy.
Keep Wood.
Let Berkman go, a team this old does not need another DH

This is exactly what is going wrong with this Country -- it has become a nation of beauracrats including OUR LEGAL SYSTEM which HAS MORE PEOPLE IN PRISION than ANY OTHER NATION ON EARTH. Prosecuting Clemens and all of the resources it will take gets no-one anywhere. Our sad criminal system surely needs review and getting prosecutors with better judgement is essential -- they love to be in the press way to much. Hoe many violent crimes are today yet unsolved in just NY or Texas?

One thing that should be done is go to a system where meren charges are not made public. Until there is a conviction there is no reason for public disclosure -- that will help stop all of this government grandstanding and "perp" walks in the press. We did not need to know Barry Bonds was charged with perjury -- if Bonds did commit a crime -- where is the conviction?

Even if Clemens is guilty (I will presume he is not) does he need 30 years of prison for some false testimony? Violent killers serve less than 30 years -- but the government and its never ending pursuit to put everyone in jail for nothing is just ridiculous and out of control. Did the hotdog eater (Kobiashi) get sentenced yet -- his crime was jumping on a stage -- what has gone wrong.

I guess the feds love a high profile case. How much time/money was spent on prosecuting Barry Bonds? Any Bonds conviction? If the only evidence against Clemens is his former trainer's testimony and some very old syringes, well, that would be a sad day to bring criminal charges against Clemens based on that.

6:34:29 PM
Aug 19, 2010

You can get up to 30 years in jail for allegedly lying to supposed liars? Wow!!! What do you get if you tell them the truth? How many campaign "promises" are kept.?..When you don't keep them, what's that called again? Can you get sent to jail for that? Well, no I guess because Congress hasn't passed a law against it.

Horatio Hornblower
Hey Washington, it's the economy stupid!  Forget about Clemens!  Besides, will you testify that congresspeople never lie?

I found this fairly easy for a Friday, until I tried to fill in the middle. FABERGEEGG, INADILEMMA and LOWSPIRITS fell right into place, as did the whole left-hand side. I had not heard of a PANELSAW, although I penciled it in. I guessed that SERGE has a diagonal rib, but I got stuck on "range" for where a lot of fireworks originate. ALIENEE was a big problem, because I don't agree that an heir is an alienee. If you sell your property, the buyer is an alienee, but an heir is not. If the property goes to an heir, i.e., an heir at law, it stays in the family and is not alienated.

Quibbles aside, this puzzle was a lot of fun, and I felt quite proud to have solved it with all those many white squares.
He's just an arrogant man. Deserves what he'll get
I...think.....I hear Piazza giggling in the distance.

Is this the level of governance expected in this country. After a decade of pillaging by Wall street and associated bankers, congress picks on a sports star "faded and jaded maybe", the country continues sink, with no leadership in sight. All Americans might as well quit now and leave for greener shores. Your chances of saving anything from the wreak, is dimming by the day, governed by dimmwits your darkest hour approaches. I wish you well USA, you going to need it.
After reading through many of these comments it doesn't take a genius to realize that there is something rotten in Denmark.

Really, and truly, is THIS what my government feels is they should be spending OUR money on?  Going after multi-millionaire ball players who use steroids????  Our debt to China is staggering, the Gulf oil spill is far from cleaned up, the unemployment rate continues to rise, Rupert Murdoch can now legally feed $1 million dollars to the political party of his choice and this is the all important issue the government is going to take care of?  WHO CARES?????  So what!  We have much bigger fish to fry.  And yes, I agree with the comment above.  A ball player lying to lying politicians.  It would be hysterical if our country's situation wasn't so tragic.
Tour de France and Major League Baseball are both so debased that it amazes me that anyone takes these 'sports' seriously.

I find it amazing that a baseball player can be indicted for lying about the use of steroids, but a sleaze like Rod Blagojevich gets away with a litany of charges...including racketeering, conspiracy, mail fraud and an attempt to sell a vacant Senate seat to the highest bidder?

If lying to Congress is a crime; shouldn't lying while in Congress also be as serious a crime, equally worthy of indictment?  Maybe there is a basic conflict between baseball and members of Congress.  Players like Roger Clemons are considered great because they kept others from running, while that is all that members of Congress know how to do run.  Personally, I think watching Roger Clemons pitch was far more interesting than watching Congress on C-Span. Beer here! Bore there!

Dear JBirns in Virginia. So, by your comments I guess nobody should be arrested or indicted because we have a bad economy? Roger Clemens should be left alone because there's a war in Afghanistan?  I have two responses to this kind of logic, which is nothing more than venting your spleen. Rather than post something thoughtful or that has any relevance to this story, you just blast everyone else because...why? Actually reading the comments about this story, which, like every other story in the news, somebody has to ruin by screaming about the Obama administration, I finally admit defeat.  I thought these comments were supposed to be on topic - a discussion about Clemen's indictment, and then these people decide it's really about them, about their opinions about everything except Roger Clemens. So because I'm sick of this kind of internet abuse, I just now called my Internet provider, and as I did with Facebook last week, I quit. No more internet, no more commenters ruining what could have been an interesting conversation. I'm going to buy the newspaper every day  - hard copy - and read it quietly without having to listen to these people who have to be angry over every single news story. There's an auto recall? Why bother? It's OBAMA's fault. Something new in fashion? How can you be so shallow? It's OBAMA's fault. It's become poisonous; it's just about anger and blame and political agendas.

Lets see if I understand this;Congress approves opening our borders to foreign goods that are produced in countries that do not have environmental,
workers rights,minimum wages,social security,etc,etc,wages that are 10 times less than our minimum wage.Our unemployment is 9.5% and they are worried about Roger Clemens.

This arrogant and smug liar brought this on himself.  I am sick of these pampered sports figures thinking that they can play by different rules than all the rest of us.  What kind of example is this for our children.  Shame on him!!

In order to salvage his reputation and keep the Hall of fame door open, Roger neeeds to hire Alberto Gonzales, ex-AG, who with his connections(Supreme Court judges, neo-CON congressmen, and an ex-owner of the Texas Rangers) will be able to plea bargain this case to a misdemeanor claiming Roger's mental state of mind and incapacity to know what is truthful or not. With Gonzo's prep expertise, Roger will attest that he was 'not sure', 'couldn't remember' or 'had a faint recollection' about his alleged drug use which he could not be positive about. Taking a page from the Iran Contra caper will put Gonzo back into the limelight of juris prudence victories as Roger Clemens evades a prison term.
Clemens indicted for lying to Congress.  Good.  Now, how about Alberto Gonzales indicted for lying to Congress?  Both did it with a smirk.

What really bothers me about this story and this man doing drugs went to a hearing in congress. Don't we have bigger fish to fry here? Do you feel like your tax dollars are being wasted in this situation? I do!

When he was playing in Toronto and we saw a lot of him, I always found him to be kind of arrogant. I know he was a leader on the field, and supposedly was first to the ballpark, and last to leave kind of thing, but in interviews he always seemed arrogant to me, IMHO.

Elliot Abrams was convicted of lying to Congress and he never served a day. In fact, he was appointed to a position in George W. Bush's State Department. Hang tough, Roger, if W is ever appointed baseball commissioner the Hall of Fame might still be in your future!

I love this quote -- "Our government cannot function if witnesses are not held accountable for false statements made before Congress,” said Ronald C. Machen Jr., the United States attorney for the District of Columbia. “Today the message is clear: if a witness makes a choice to ignore his or her obligation to testify honestly, there will be consequences.” ... Whilst I have no sympathy for Clemens, I think it a pity that the same standard was not applied when a sitting U.S. President was found to have done the same but, hey, that was no big deal, as it was "only about sex", right? The message for our youth, I suppose, is that if you are going to commit perjury and obstruct justice, it is better to be a poltician than a sports hero.
And this is how we really need to spend our money?  How much is this costing tax payers?  May we focus on what is important?  Please????
More blame are on the coaches and owners because they have to know that all the players are clean when playing a game, just tested them before the beginning of the game. Why nobody talk about that.
